class.name: FunctionUtils
class.javadoc:
Utilities for manipulating function objects.
$Id: FunctionUtils.java 1455194 2013-03-11 15:45:54Z luc $
3.0
Class only contains static methods.

Composes functions.
The functions in the argument list are composed sequentially, in the given order. For example, compose(f1,f2,f3) acts like f1(f2(f3(x))). f List of functions. the composite function.

Composes functions.
The functions in the argument list are composed sequentially, in the given order. For example, compose(f1,f2,f3) acts like f1(f2(f3(x))). f List of functions. the composite function. 3.1

Composes functions.
The functions in the argument list are composed sequentially, in the given order. For example, compose(f1,f2,f3) acts like f1(f2(f3(x))). f List of functions. the composite function. as of 3.1 replaced by {@link #compose(UnivariateDifferentiableFunction)}

Adds functions.
f List of functions.
a function that computes the sum of the functions.

Adds functions.
f List of functions.
a function that computes the sum of the functions.

class.javadoc:
Adds functions.

a function that computes the product of the functions.

Multiplies functions.
f List of functions.
a function that computes the product of the functions.
as of 3.1 replaced by {@link #multiply(UnivariateDifferentiableFunction)}

Returns the univariate function
{@code h(x) = combiner(f(x), g(x))}. combiner Combiner function. f Function. g Function. the composite function.

Returns a MultivariateFunction h(x[]) defined by 
 
                  h(x[]) = combiner(...combiner(combiner(initialValue,f(x[0])),f(x[1]))...),f(x[x.length-1]))
combiner Combiner function. f Function. initialValue Initial value. a collector function.

Returns a MultivariateFunction h(x[]) defined by 
 
                  h(x[]) = combiner(...combiner(combiner(initialValue,x[0]),x[1])...),x[x.length-1])
combiner Combiner function. initialValue Initial value. a collector function.

Creates a unary function by fixing the first argument of a binary function.
f Binary function.
fixed Value to which the first argument of {@code f} is set.
the unary function h(x) = f(fixed, x)

Creates a unary function by fixing the second argument of a binary function.
f Binary function.
fixed Value to which the second argument of {@code f} is set.
the unary function h(x) = f(x, fixed)

Samples the specified univariate real function on the specified interval.
The interval is divided equally into {@code n} sections and sample points are taken from {@code min} to {@code max - (max - min) / n}; therefore{@code f} is not sampled at the upper bound {@code max}. f Function to be sampled min Lower bound of the interval (included). max Upper bound of the interval (excluded). n Number of sample points. the array of samples. NumberIsTooLargeException if the lower bound {@code min} is greater than, or equal to the upper bound {@code max}. NotStrictlyPositiveException if the number of sample points{@code n} is negative.

Convert a {@link UnivariateDifferentiableFunction} into a {@link DifferentiableUnivariateFunction}.
f function to convert
converted function
this conversion method is temporary in version 3.1, as the {@link DifferentiableUnivariateFunction} interface itself is deprecated

Convert a {@link DifferentiableUnivariateFunction} into a {@link UnivariateDifferentiableFunction}.

Note that the converted function is able to handle {@link DerivativeStructure} up to order one. If the function is called with higher order, a {@link NumberIsTooLargeException} will be thrown.

f function to convert converted function this conversion method is temporary in version 3.1, as the {@link DifferentiableUnivariateFunction} interface itself is deprecated

anonymous_class.javadoc:
{@inheritDoc}
NumberIsTooLargeException if derivation order is greater than 1

class.javadoc:
Convert a {@link MultivariateDifferentiableFunction} into a {@link DifferentiableMultivariateFunction}.
f function to convert
converted function
this conversion method is temporary in version 3.1, as the {@link DifferentiableMultivariateFunction} interface itself is deprecated

Convert a {@link DifferentiableMultivariateFunction} into a {@link MultivariateDifferentiableFunction}.

Note that the converted function is able to handle {@link DerivativeStructure} elements that all have the same number of free parameters and order, and with order at most 1. If the function is called with inconsistent numbers of free parameters or higher order, a{@link DimensionMismatchException} or a {@link NumberIsTooLargeException} will be thrown.

f function to convert converted function this conversion method is temporary in version 3.1, as the {@link DifferentiableMultivariateFunction} interface itself is deprecated

method.name: toMultivariateDifferentiableFunction
method.comment: check all elements in the array are consistent
merge value and gradient into one DerivativeStructure

method.name: value
method.comment: check all elements in the array are consistent
merge value and gradient into one DerivativeStructure

class.javadoc:
Convert a {@link MultivariateDifferentiableVectorFunction} into a {@link DifferentiableMultivariateVectorFunction}.
f function to convert
converted function
this conversion method is temporary in version 3.1, as the {@link DifferentiableMultivariateVectorFunction} interface itself is deprecated

Convert a {@link DifferentiableMultivariateVectorFunction} into a {@link MultivariateDifferentiableVectorFunction}.

Note that the converted function is able to handle {@link DerivativeStructure} elements that all have the same number of free parameters and order, and with order at most 1. If the function is called with inconsistent numbers of free parameters or higher order, a{@link DimensionMismatchException} or a {@link NumberIsTooLargeException} will be thrown.

f function to convert converted function this conversion method is temporary in version 3.1, as the {@link DifferentiableMultivariateFunction} interface itself is deprecated

method.name: toMultivariateDifferentiableVectorFunction
method.comment: check all elements in the array are consistent
merge value and Jacobian into a DerivativeStructure array

method.comment: check all elements in the array are consistent
merge value and Jacobian into a DerivativeStructure array
